item.description:
...or, "Squamscott, Lamprey, Great Bay" - Oh My!

We'll paddle down the scenic Squamscott River and out into the wide expanse of Great Bay. Then we'll float up the wild Lamprey River, under soaring ospreys (and bald eagles if we're lucky), before landing finally in the up-and-coming village of Newmarket.

Once in Newmarket, we can stretch our legs, stroll through town, and have a beer or an ice cream cone before heading back downstream.

This will be an easy to moderate paddle of about 8 miles roundtrip, traveling mostly with the tide.

In addition to ospreys, there are abundant herons and kingfishers and horseshoe crabs and salt marsh and great pine trees and who knows what-all else!

And a lot of laughs as usual!

The Lamprey and Squamscott are smaller rivers with little motor boat traffic.  All kayaks are welcome. And we'll pass through some favorite areas of local birders along the river where lots of songbird species may be found.  The entire trip will last 4-5 hours including stops.

Rental Kayak Available.  Click here to reserve.

Newmarket, NH: The town received a huge make-over in the summer of 2008.  The sidewalks are wider and some are now made of brick. There are new light fixtures and trees are being planted all around. And all of the telephone poles were removed in the summer of 2009. There are new shops and pubs and lots of flowers. It's become a very nice place to spend an afternoon!

Directions: Chapman's Landing is located on Route 108 / College Road, Stratham/Newfields, NH.  A very easy drive from Mass!  From the south, the landing is just before the bridge, on your right.

OH! And there's live, danceable REGGAE at Salisbury Beach from 4pm to 8pm if you need something to do afterward...

Liability Release

AS A CONDITION OF ATTENDING THIS MEETUP, YOU AGREE TO hold harmless, and indemnify the organizer and his heirs, and all members and participants of the Seacoast Outdoors Meetup group from any and all claims for injury, illness, death, and/or property damage including those caused by negligence, ignorance, inexperience and other reasons.

You also agree to assume all mental, physical, financial, and/or other risk associated with this meetup. Kayaking, camping, hiking, bicycling, snow sports, alcohol consumption, and other activities pose inherent risks and dangers. Participation in these activities is voluntary and dependent upon your own personal judgment.

*Unless otherwise specified, refunds for timely cancellations will be processed the day after the event.

*Time and location are subject to change due to weather and other factors.  Always check email & this listing for updates before leaving home.

Click here for a note on event fees.
item.name: Newfields to Newmaket & Back Again!
